org.svvrl.goal.core.tran.extendedonthefly
Interface ExtendedOnTheFly

All Known Implementing Classes:
ExtendedGPVW, ExtendedGPVWPlus, ExtendedLTL2AUT, ExtendedLTL2AUTPlus, ExtendedOnTheFlyAdapter
public interface ExtendedOnTheFly

This class provides an interface for the settings of an on-the-fly algorithm. Refer to [Marco Daniele, Fausto Giunchiglia, Moshe Y. Vardi: Improved Automata Generation for Linear Temporal Logic. CAV 1999: 249-260] for more details.

Author:
Wen-Chin Chan

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of this on-the-fly algorithm.

Returns:
the name of this on-the-fly algorithm

check

void check(LTL f)
           throws UnsupportedException
Checks if a specified formula is supported by this on-the-fly algorithm. Throws an exception with explanation if the formula is not supported.

Parameters:
f - a LTL formula to be checked
Throws:
UnsupportedException - if f is not supported by this on-the-fly algorithm

hasToBeStored

boolean hasToBeStored(LTL mu)
Returns true if the formula should be stored in the cover.

Parameters:
mu - a LTL formula
Returns:
true if f should be stored in the cover

isContradiction

boolean isContradiction(LTL mu,
                        java.util.Set<LTL> toCover,
                        java.util.Set<LTL> current,
                        java.util.Set<LTL> covered)
Returns true if adding mu to the cover will cause contradiction. For example, in GPVW, it returns true if (1) mu is false or (2) mu is a literal and its negation is contained in current.

Parameters:
mu - a formula to be inserted to the cover
toCover - the LTL formulae to be covered
current - the current cover element
covered - the LTL formulae covered
Returns:
true if adding mu to the cover will cause contradiction

isRedundant

boolean isRedundant(LTL mu,
                    java.util.Set<LTL> toCover,
                    java.util.Set<LTL> current,
                    java.util.Set<LTL> covered)
Returns true if mu is redundant and its cover does not need to be computed.

Parameters:
mu - a formula to be inserted to the cover
toCover - the LTL formulae to be covered
current - the current cover element
covered - the LTL formulae covered
Returns:
true if mu is redundant and its cover does not need to be computed

isSatisfy

boolean isSatisfy(java.util.Set<LTL> s,
                  LTL mu)
Returns true if that all formulae in s are satisfied implies that mu is also satisfied.

Parameters:
s - a set of LTL formulae
mu - an LTL formula
Returns:
true if that all formulae in s are satisfied implies that mu is also satisfied
